section: Divine Love vs Miracles and Illusion
text: Kabir and other Perfect Masters emphasize that miracles and yogic powers have no spiritual value. True divine love alone burns away desires without display. Both the world and the spiritual path are forms of illusion—false illusion and real illusion—while God alone is the only Reality. Knowledge removes ignorance, but Truth remains hidden until the soul enters the divine path.

The apparent separation between man and God is described as a sevenfold veil. This veil consists of seven folds tied by seven knots, representing seven root desires and seven fundamental impressions connected with the seven sensory openings of the face. These folds of ignorance conceal man’s real identity as God.

section: Symbolism of the Human Body and Third Eye
text: The human body symbolically reflects divine reality. The head represents the highest spiritual state; the forehead is the entrance to divinity; and the third eye is the seat of divine vision. Passing through the seven sensory doors corresponds to the soul’s ascent through the spiritual planes.

section: First, Second and Third Seven-in-One Achievements
text: Each spiritual advance removes a fold of the veil through a seven-in-one achievement: unfastening a knot, removing a fold, crushing a root desire, wiping impressions, removing a dark colour, passing a sensory door, and arriving on a plane. The first three achievements correspond to progress through the subtle sphere and involve increasing wonder and the risk of mistaking the plane for the final goal.

section: Fourth Achievement – The Dark Night of the Soul
text: The fourth achievement is a double achievement leading to the fourth plane, the height of spiritual power and splendour. Here pilgrims face grave danger from misuse of divine powers. Without the guidance of a Perfect Master, a soul may fall back to stone-consciousness. This stage is known as the dark night of the soul.

section: Fifth Achievement and the Friends of God
text: The fifth achievement removes all seven folds of the veil and leads to the fifth plane of light and love. Souls here are known as wali Allah, the friends of God. Though the folds are gone, the veil itself remains, and God is not yet seen face to face. These souls are secure and often help others.

By the grace of a Perfect Master, the veil itself is removed and the soul enters the sixth plane, where God is seen face to face everywhere. This is conviction by sight. However, duality still remains, as the seer and the seen are not yet one.

section: Seventh Plane and the Role of Perfect Masters
text: On the seventh plane the soul becomes one with God, attaining infinite knowledge, power and bliss. Some remain absorbed as Majzoobs, while others, by the help of a Perfect Master, return as Man-God or Perfect Masters, fully conscious of all worlds while retaining God-consciousness. A Perfect Master can impart God-realization instantly by removing ignorance.
